## Description {#details}

Logging utility - given an ordered specification of features, and assuming a scalar reward, allow logging feature values and rewards.

The assumption is that, for an event to be logged (i.e. a set of feature values and a reward), the user calls the log&#42; API for each feature exactly once, providing the index matching the position in the feature spec list provided at construction. The example assumes the first feature&#39;s element type is float, the second is int64, and the reward is float:

event 0: logFloatValue(0, ...) logInt64Value(1, ...) ... logFloatReward(...) event 1: logFloatValue(0, ...) logInt64Value(1, ...) ... logFloatReward(...)

At the end, call print to generate the log. Alternatively, don&#39;t call logReward at the end of each event, just log&#123;Float|Int32|Int64&#125;FinalReward at the end.

Definition at line 91 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/include/llvm/analysis/utils/traininglogger-h">TrainingLogger.h</a>.

## Public Constructors

### Logger() {#afa8b89d00af0e306a92b7e9c9d5bc681}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Logger::Logger (std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &gt; OS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::vector&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/tensorspec">TensorSpec</a> &gt; &amp; FeatureSpecs, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/tensorspec">TensorSpec</a> &amp; RewardSpec, bool IncludeReward, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/tensorspec">TensorSpec</a> &gt; AdviceSpec=std::nullopt)</>}>
Construct a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/logger">Logger</a>.

If IncludeReward is false, then logReward or logFinalReward shouldn&#39;t be called, and the reward feature won&#39;t be printed out. NOTE: the FeatureSpecs are expected to be in the same order (i.e. have corresponding indices) with any <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mlmodelrunner">MLModelRunner</a> implementations corresponding to the model being trained/logged.
